hints_html:
Use change of variables to find the definite integral \(\int_b^{-1}e^{2x}dx\).

What happens when \(b\to -\infty\)?
hints_latex:

What happens when $b\to -\infty$?
hints_raw:
Use change of variables to find the definite integral <math> \int_b^{-1}e^{2x}dx </math>.

What happens when <math> b\to -\infty </math>?
question: 1 (f)
sols_html:
Letting \(u=2x\) we get \(du=2dx\) so

\[\begin{aligned} \int_b^{-1}e^{2x}dx&=\frac{1}{2}\int_{2b}^{-2}e^u du\\ &=\frac{1}{2}e^u\Big|_{2b}^{-2}\\ &=\frac{1}{2e^2}-\frac{e^{2b}}{2}\end{aligned}\]

When \(b\to -\infty\) we have \(\frac{e^{2b}}{2} \to 0\) so

\[\begin{aligned} \int_{-\infty}^{-1}e^{2x}dx=\frac{1}{2e^2}-0= \frac{1}{2e^2}\end{aligned}\]
